subject: RE: [junit] JUnit fossilized at 3.8.1?
msgSnippet: ... It is to me and probably to a lot of people on this list. I was naively hoping they would take the time to discuss their plans on the junit mailing-list as
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

> I just heard Kent's developer testing presentation from
> Agitar today and he mentioned that JUnit 4.0 can actually be
> checked out of CVS and the biggest change is for support for
> annotations from Java 5.
>
> You probably all know this already ... but just in case it is
> news to anyone.

It is to me and probably to a lot of people on this list.

I was naively hoping they would take the time to discuss their plans on the
junit mailing-list as their work progress, but it looks like they are not
really interested in getting feedback from the 5800+ people on this list :-(

--
